---
title: "Histograms for Multiple CSVs in Folder"
format: html
---

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(readr)

# List all CSV files in 'histogram-data' folder
csv_files <- list.files(path = "histogram-data", pattern = "\\.csv$", full.names = TRUE)

for (file in csv_files) {
  data <- read_csv(file, col_names = FALSE, show_col_types = FALSE)
  
  # Force binwidth = 1 for integer values
  p <- ggplot(data, aes(x = X1)) +
    geom_histogram(binwidth = 1, fill = "steelblue", color = "black", boundary = 0.5) +
    scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(min(data$X1), max(data$X1), by = 1)) +
    labs(x = "Value", y = "Frequency", title = paste("Histogram:", basename(file))) +
    theme_minimal() +
    theme(
      axis.text = element_text(size = 12),
      axis.title = element_text(size = 14),
      plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold")
    )
  
  print(p)
}
```
